title: (x) High-contrast sans caps - Britannic {Kermit, Rainer}
content:
Can somebody help me to identify this font? It looks similar to peignot but is far more condensed!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202042601im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_4894.jpg)
author: noelleu

comments.content: The more popular version would be [Britannic](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202042601/http:/www.identifont.com/show?69N). Don't know where Linotype got this version â€¦?

I think this is another of those cases where foundries imitate popular styles and slightly change a couple of letters and/or the name to avoid copyright issues ;-)

- Mike Yanega

I'm still not sure wheter it's realy Britannic. In my eyes this typeface looks a bit smoother but its realy hard to tell with the qualitiy of the image.

Thanks a lot for your quick feedback I realy apreciate your help and if you have any further suggestions you're welcome to post!
